kvm.title: KVM/QEMU Virtual Machine Management
kvm.overview_desc: KVM (Kernel-basierte Virtuelle Maschine) ist eine Virtualisierungstechnologie, die in den Linux-Kernel integriert ist. In Kombination mit QEMU fÃ¼r Hardware-Emulation und libvirt fÃ¼r die Verwaltung bietet sie unternehmenstaugliche Funktionen fÃ¼r virtuelle Maschinen. SysManage integriert sich mit KVM/libvirt, um eine nahtlose VM-Erstellung und Lebenszyklusverwaltung Ã¼ber die WeboberflÃ¤che zu ermÃ¶glichen.
kvm.req_cpu: CPU mit Hardware-VirtualisierungsunterstÃ¼tzung (Intel VT-x oder AMD-V)
kvm.req_user: Der sysmanage-agent-Benutzer muss in der libvirt-Gruppe sein
kvm.detection_desc: SysManage erkennt automatisch die KVM-FÃ¤higkeit durch ÃœberprÃ¼fung von:
kvm.detection_role: Bei Erkennung wird dem Host die Rolle KVM Host zugewiesen und KVM erscheint als verfÃ¼gbarer Virtualisierungstyp.
kvm.setup_desc: Um einen Host fÃ¼r die KVM-Virtual-Machine-Verwaltung vorzubereiten:
kvm.setup_step2: KVM-Pakete installieren: sudo apt install qemu-kvm libvirt-daemon-system (Debian/Ubuntu) oder sudo dnf install qemu-kvm libvirt (Fedora/RHEL)
kvm.setup_step3: libvirtd aktivieren und starten: sudo systemctl enable --now libvirtd
kvm.setup_step4: Agent-Benutzer zur libvirt-Gruppe hinzufÃ¼gen: sudo usermod -aG libvirt sysmanage-agent
kvm.setup_step5: Standardnetzwerk konfigurieren: sudo virsh net-autostart default && sudo virsh net-start default
kvm.setup_step6: sysmanage-agent-Dienst neu starten, um Gruppenmitgliedschaft zu Ã¼bernehmen
kvm.setup_auto: Alternativ klicken Sie auf "KVM aktivieren" in der SysManage-WeboberflÃ¤che, um diese Einrichtungsschritte zu automatisieren.
kvm.creation_desc: Bei der Erstellung einer KVM-Virtual-Machine Ã¼ber SysManage:
kvm.creation_step1: SysManage lÃ¤dt das Cloud-Image von der offiziellen Quelle der Distribution herunter
kvm.creation_step2: Ein neues Disk-Image wird erstellt und das Cloud-Image als Backing Store angewendet
kvm.creation_step3: Cloud-init-Konfiguration wird mit Hostname, Benutzerkonto und Agent-Einstellungen generiert
kvm.creation_step4: Die VM wird in libvirt mit den angegebenen Ressourcen (CPU, Speicher, Disk) definiert
kvm.creation_step5: VM startet und cloud-init konfiguriert das System, erstellt den Benutzer und installiert den Agent
kvm.creation_step6: Der sysmanage-agent-Dienst startet und verbindet sich mit Ihrem SysManage-Server
kvm.creation_step7: Die VM erscheint in der Host-Liste zur Genehmigung (oder automatisch genehmigt, falls ausgewÃ¤hlt)
kvm.form_desc: Bei der Erstellung von KVM-VMs sind zusÃ¤tzliche Konfigurationsoptionen verfÃ¼gbar:
kvm.field_vm_name: VM-Name: Der libvirt-Domainname (muss auf dem Host eindeutig sein)
kvm.field_cpus: vCPUs: Anzahl der virtuellen CPUs - Standard ist 2
kvm.networking_desc: KVM-VMs verbinden sich mit dem libvirt-Standardnetzwerk, das bietet:
kvm.net_dhcp: DHCP: VMs erhalten automatisch IP-Adressen von der virbr0-BrÃ¼cke (typischerweise 192.168.122.x)
kvm.net_nat: NAT: Ausgehende KonnektivitÃ¤t wird Ã¼ber NAT durch den Host bereitgestellt
kvm.net_dns: DNS: VMs verwenden die DNS-Server des Hosts fÃ¼r die NamensauflÃ¶sung
kvm.networking_bridged: FÃ¼r fortgeschrittenes Netzwerk unterstÃ¼tzt SysManage auch den Bridged-Modus, bei dem VMs IP-Adressen direkt vom DHCP-Server Ihres Netzwerks erhalten.
kvm.lifecycle_desc: Nach der Erstellung unterstÃ¼tzen KVM-VMs den vollen Umfang von Lebenszyklusoperationen:
kvm.lifecycle_stop: Stopp: Die VM mit virsh shutdown sauber herunterfahren
kvm.lifecycle_restart: Neustart: Die VM mit virsh reboot neu starten
kvm.lifecycle_delete: LÃ¶schen: Die VM und ihren Speicher mit virsh undefine --remove-all-storage entfernen
kvm.distributions_desc: KVM-VMs kÃ¶nnen mit Cloud-Images von Distributionen erstellt werden, bei denen der sysmanage-agent verfÃ¼gbar ist:

architecture.agent_collector: Firewall Collector (src/sysmanage_agent/operations/firewall_collector.py): Detects and parses firewall status
architecture.flow_step1: User clicks firewall button in web interface
architecture.flow_step10: Frontend receives real-time update via WebSocket
architecture.flow_step2: Frontend sends REST API request to server
architecture.flow_step4: Server enqueues firewall command message for agent
architecture.flow_step5: Agent retrieves command from outbound message queue
architecture.flow_step8: Agent sends status update to server via inbound queue
architecture.server_api: Firewall Status API (backend/api/firewall_status.py): REST endpoints for firewall operations
architecture.server_models: Database Models (backend/persistence/models/core.py): FirewallStatus table for storing firewall state
architecture.server_queue: Message Queue: Queues firewall commands for delivery to agents
architecture.title: Technical Architecture

best_practices.configuration_practice1: Regularly review and audit firewall rules
best_practices.configuration_practice2: Use restart operation after manual configuration changes
best_practices.configuration_practice3: Document all manual firewall rule modifications
best_practices.configuration_practice4: Implement firewall configuration as code where possible
best_practices.deployment_practice1: Test firewall deployment on non-production hosts first
best_practices.deployment_practice2: Ensure you have alternate access (console, IPMI) before enabling firewalls on remote hosts
best_practices.deployment_practice3: Document custom port requirements before deployment
best_practices.deployment_practice4: Use gradual rollout for firewall deployment across large infrastructures
best_practices.monitoring_practice1: Set up alerts for hosts with disabled firewalls
best_practices.monitoring_practice2: Regularly review open ports across your infrastructure
best_practices.monitoring_practice3: Verify firewall status as part of security audits
best_practices.monitoring_practice4: Monitor for unexpected firewall status changes
best_practices.security_practice1: Grant firewall management roles only to trusted administrators
best_practices.security_practice2: Monitor firewall disable operations in security logs
best_practices.security_practice3: Implement alerts for firewall status changes
best_practices.security_practice4: Regularly verify firewall status matches security policy
best_practices.security_practice5: Use principle of least privilege when opening ports
best_practices.title: Best Practices

monitoring.automatic_updates_description: The agent automatically collects firewall status and sends updates to the server:
monitoring.description: The Firewall Status card on each host detail page provides real-time information about the firewall configuration.

info.firewall_name: Firewall Name: The detected firewall software (e.g., ufw, firewalld, IPFW, PF, NPF, Windows Defender Firewall)
info.ipv4_ports: IPv4 Ports: Ports configured for IPv4 traffic
info.ipv6_ports: IPv6 Ports: Ports configured for IPv6 traffic
info.last_updated: Last Updated: Timestamp of the last status update from the agent
info.tcp_ports: TCP Open Ports: List of TCP ports with active allow rules
info.udp_ports: UDP Open Ports: List of UDP ports with active allow rules

monitoring.title: Firewall Status Monitoring

updates.after_operations: Immediate update after deploy, enable, disable, or restart operations
updates.periodic: Periodic collection as part of regular system metrics gathering
updates.realtime_display: Real-time display updates via WebSocket communication

deploy.automatic_ports_description: When deploying or enabling a firewall, SysManage automatically opens the following ports:
deploy.description: The Deploy Firewall operation installs and configures firewall software on hosts that don't have it installed or enabled.
deploy.port_agent: Agent Communication Port: Dynamically determined from agent configuration
deploy.port_server: Server Ports (if applicable): Opened if SysManage server is detected on the host
deploy.step1: Navigate to the host detail page for the target system
deploy.step4: SysManage will automatically detect the appropriate firewall for the OS
deploy.step5: The agent installs the firewall package and configures initial rules
deploy.step6: Agent communication ports are automatically opened to prevent lockout
deploy.title: Deploy Firewall

disable.description: The Disable Firewall operation stops the firewall service, allowing all traffic through the host.
disable.step1: Navigate to the host detail page
disable.step2: Click the Disable Firewall button in the Firewall Status card
disable.step4: Firewall status will update to "Disabled" in real-time
disable.title: Disable Firewall
disable.warning_description: Disabling the firewall removes network protection and exposes all services to the network. Only disable firewalls in controlled environments or when troubleshooting network connectivity issues.

enable.description: The Enable Firewall operation starts the firewall service on a host where firewall software is installed but disabled.
enable.step1: Navigate to the host detail page
enable.step2: Click the Enable Firewall button in the Firewall Status card
enable.step3: The firewall service will start and required ports will be opened
enable.step4: Firewall status will update to "Enabled" in real-time
enable.title: Enable Firewall

restart.description: The Restart Firewall operation stops and starts the firewall service, reloading configuration and rules.
restart.step1: Navigate to the host detail page
restart.step2: Click the Restart Firewall button in the Firewall Status card
restart.step3: The firewall service will restart and reload all rules
restart.step4: Use this after manually modifying firewall configuration files
restart.title: Restart Firewall

security.assignment_step1: Navigate to Administration â†’ User Management
security.assignment_step4: Select the appropriate firewall management roles
security.description: Firewall management operations are protected by role-based access control (RBAC). Users must have specific security roles to perform firewall operations.
security.role_assignment_description: Administrators can assign firewall roles to users through the user management interface:
security.role_deploy: DEPLOY_FIREWALL: Required to deploy firewall software to hosts
security.role_view: VIEW_FIREWALL_STATUS: Required to view firewall status (automatically granted with any firewall role)
security.title: Security and Access Control

bsd.description: BSD platforms support multiple firewall frameworks:
bsd.ipfw: IPFW: FreeBSD's stateful firewall with flexible rule syntax
bsd.npf: NPF: NetBSD's modern, efficient packet filter designed for scalability
bsd.pf: PF: OpenBSD's sophisticated packet filter available on all BSD variants
bsd.title: BSD Systems

linux.description: SysManage supports the following firewall solutions on Linux:
linux.firewalld: firewalld - Dynamic firewall management tool for RHEL, CentOS, Fedora, and openSUSE
linux.iptables: iptables - Legacy netfilter firewall for Linux systems
linux.nftables: nftables - Modern packet filtering framework replacing iptables
linux.title: Linux Systems
linux.ufw: UFW (Uncomplicated Firewall) - User-friendly firewall frontend for iptables on Ubuntu/Debian systems

macos.pf: PF (Packet Filter): OpenBSD's packet filter ported to macOS
macos.title: macOS

windows.defender: Windows Defender Firewall: Integrated host-based firewall with advanced security features
windows.profiles: Support for Domain, Private, and Public network profiles
windows.rules: Inbound and outbound rule management via PowerShell and netsh
windows.title: Windows

troubleshooting.deploy_fails_solution1: Verify the agent is running with elevated privileges (root/Administrator)
troubleshooting.deploy_fails_solution2: Check network connectivity to package repositories
troubleshooting.deploy_fails_solution3: Review agent logs for detailed error messages
troubleshooting.deploy_fails_solution4: Ensure package manager is functioning (apt, yum, dnf, pkg, etc.)
troubleshooting.deploy_fails_symptoms: Symptoms: Deploy operation returns error or times out
troubleshooting.locked_out_solution1: This should not happen - agent automatically opens required ports
troubleshooting.locked_out_solution2: Access host via console or out-of-band management
troubleshooting.locked_out_solution3: Manually disable firewall and check agent configuration
troubleshooting.locked_out_solution4: Verify agent port configuration matches firewall rules
troubleshooting.locked_out_symptoms: Symptoms: Cannot connect to agent after enabling firewall
troubleshooting.no_firewall_detected_solution1: Click "Deploy Firewall" to install firewall software automatically
troubleshooting.no_firewall_detected_solution2: Verify the agent has privileges to detect firewall status
troubleshooting.no_firewall_detected_solution3: Check agent logs for firewall detection errors
troubleshooting.no_firewall_detected_symptoms: Symptoms: Firewall Status card shows "No firewall detected"
troubleshooting.permission_denied_solution1: Verify your user account has the required firewall security role
troubleshooting.permission_denied_solution2: Contact administrator to request firewall management permissions
troubleshooting.permission_denied_solution3: Check that role assignments have been saved and user session refreshed
troubleshooting.permission_denied_symptoms: Symptoms: Button is disabled or operation returns "Permission denied"
troubleshooting.status_not_updating_solution1: Click "Request Host Data" to force immediate status collection
troubleshooting.status_not_updating_solution3: Review agent logs for errors during status collection
troubleshooting.status_not_updating_solution4: Verify WebSocket connection is active (check browser console)
troubleshooting.status_not_updating_symptoms: Symptoms: Firewall Status card shows stale or incorrect information
troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting

deploy_early.description: Deploy antivirus software immediately after host approval for maximum protection.
deploy_early.title: Deploy Early

monitor_regularly.description: Regularly review antivirus status across your infrastructure to ensure all systems are protected.
monitor_regularly.title: Monitor Regularly

privileged_agents.description: Ensure agents run with elevated privileges (root/administrator) to enable full antivirus management capabilities.
privileged_agents.title: Run Agents with Privileges

role_based_access.description: Restrict antivirus management permissions to trusted administrators only, especially REMOVE_ANTIVIRUS and DISABLE_ANTIVIRUS roles.
role_based_access.title: Use Role-Based Access Control

standards.description: Use the default configuration feature to ensure consistent antivirus deployment across all hosts of the same operating system.

test_deployments.description: Test antivirus deployment on non-production hosts before rolling out to production systems.

defaults.description: SysManage allows administrators to define which antivirus software should be deployed for each operating system. These defaults are used when deploying antivirus to hosts.
defaults.permissions_description: Managing antivirus defaults requires the MANAGE_ANTIVIRUS_DEFAULTS security role. Contact your administrator if you need this permission.
defaults.step1: Navigate to Settings in the main menu
defaults.step3: For each operating system, select the desired antivirus package from the dropdown
defaults.step4: Select "None" to disable automatic antivirus deployment for that OS
defaults.title: Setting Default Antivirus Software

deployment.overview_description: Antivirus deployment in SysManage is a fully automated process that installs and configures the antivirus software appropriate for the target host's operating system.

process.description: The deployment process varies slightly by platform but generally follows these steps:

linux_bsd.step2: ClamAV and related packages are downloaded and installed
linux_bsd.step3: freshclam service is enabled and started (updates virus definitions)
linux_bsd.step4: clamd service is enabled and started (real-time scanning daemon)
linux_bsd.step5: Initial virus definition update is performed
linux_bsd.step6: Agent reports deployment status back to server

macos.step2: freshclam is configured and virus definitions are updated
macos.step3: ClamAV service is started via brew services

process.title: What Happens During Deployment

windows.step1: ClamAV for Windows installer is downloaded
windows.step3: ClamAV Windows service is configured and started

requirements.active_host: Host must be active and connected to the server
requirements.default_configured: A default antivirus package must be configured for the host's operating system
requirements.network: Host must have internet access to download antivirus packages
requirements.privileged_agent: Agent must be running with elevated privileges (root/administrator)
requirements.title: Prerequisites

steps.step1: Navigate to Hosts in the main menu
steps.step2: Click on the desired host to view its details
steps.step3: Scroll to the Antivirus card on the host detail page
steps.step4: If no antivirus is detected, you will see a "Deploy Antivirus" button
steps.step6: Confirm the deployment in the dialog that appears
steps.step7: Monitor the deployment progress - the antivirus card will update when deployment completes
steps.title: Deploying via Web Interface

deployment.title: Deploying Antivirus Software

header.subtitle: Comprehensive guide to deploying, configuring, and managing antivirus software across your infrastructure with real-time monitoring and control.
header.title: Antivirus Management

antivirus.meta_description: Complete guide to deploying, managing, and monitoring antivirus software across your infrastructure with SysManage.

indicators.disabled: Disabled (Yellow): Antivirus is installed but not running
indicators.enabled: Enabled (Green): Antivirus is installed and actively running
indicators.not_installed: Not Installed (Gray): No antivirus software detected on the host
indicators.title: Status Indicators

monitoring.overview_description: SysManage agents automatically detect installed antivirus software and report status information to the server. This information is displayed in real-time on the host detail page.

status.enabled_state: Enabled/Disabled: Whether the antivirus service is currently running
status.install_path: Installation Path: Where the antivirus software is installed
status.last_updated: Last Updated: When the status information was last refreshed
status.software_name: Software Name: The name of the detected antivirus software (e.g., "ClamAV")
status.title: Status Information Displayed
status.version: Version: The installed version of the antivirus software

monitoring.title: Monitoring Antivirus Status

viewing.step1: Navigate to Hosts in the main menu
viewing.step3: Scroll to the Antivirus section on the host detail page
viewing.step4: Status information is displayed in a card with a shield icon
viewing.title: Viewing Antivirus Status

overview.description: SysManage provides centralized management of open-source antivirus software across all supported platforms. The platform automates deployment, enables real-time monitoring of antivirus status, and provides tools to enable, disable, or remove antivirus software remotely.

features.auto_detection: Automatic Detection: Agents automatically detect and report antivirus software status
features.centralized_config: Centralized Configuration: Define default antivirus packages per operating system
features.cross_platform: Cross-Platform Support: Manage antivirus on Linux, BSD, macOS, and Windows systems
features.realtime_status: Real-time Status: Monitor antivirus status, version, and enabled/disabled state
features.remote_deployment: Remote Deployment: Deploy antivirus software from the web interface with one click
features.service_control: Service Control: Enable or disable antivirus services remotely

overview.title: Overview

security_roles.deploy: Allows user to deploy antivirus software to hosts
security_roles.disable: Allows user to disable antivirus services on hosts
security_roles.enable: Allows user to enable antivirus services on hosts
security_roles.manage_defaults: Allows user to configure default antivirus packages per operating system
security_roles.remove: Allows user to completely remove antivirus software from hosts
security_roles.title: Security Roles

disable.description: To temporarily disable antivirus without removing it:
disable.step1: Navigate to the host detail page
disable.step2: In the Antivirus card, click Disable Antivirus
disable.step3: Confirm the action in the dialog
disable.step4: The agent will stop the antivirus service
disable.title: Disabling Antivirus
disable.warning: âš ï¸ Security Warning: Disabling antivirus leaves the system vulnerable to malware. Only disable antivirus when necessary for troubleshooting.

enable.description: If antivirus is installed but disabled, you can enable it remotely:
enable.step1: Navigate to the host detail page
enable.step2: In the Antivirus card, click Enable Antivirus
enable.step3: Confirm the action in the dialog
enable.step4: The agent will start the antivirus service and report the new status
enable.title: Enabling Antivirus

remove.description: To completely remove antivirus software from a host:

alerting.meta_description: Configurable alerting with email, webhook, Slack, and Microsoft Teams notifications for proactive infrastructure monitoring.

header.title: Alerting Engine Module
header.description: Configurable alerting with multiple notification channels to keep you informed about critical infrastructure events in real-time.

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: The Alerting Engine provides proactive notification when your infrastructure needs attention. Define custom alert rules based on host conditions, and receive notifications through your preferred channels - email, webhooks, Slack, or Microsoft Teams.

conditions.title: Alert Conditions
conditions.description: Create alert rules based on various infrastructure conditions:

host_down.title: Host Down
host_down.description: Alert when a host stops reporting for a configurable time threshold (default: 10 minutes).

reboot.title: Reboot Required
reboot.description: Alert when a host requires a reboot to apply system updates or configuration changes.

updates.title: Updates Available
updates.description: Alert when a host has pending package updates, with configurable minimum count.

disk.title: Disk Usage
disk.description: Alert when disk usage exceeds a threshold percentage on specified mount points.

cve.title: CVE Severity
cve.description: Alert when hosts have vulnerabilities at or above a specified severity level.

custom.title: Custom Metrics
custom.description: Alert based on custom metric thresholds with configurable operators and values.

channels.title: Notification Channels
channels.description: Configure multiple notification channels to receive alerts:

webhook.title: Webhook
webhook.json: JSON payload with full alert details

severity.title: Alert Severity Levels
severity.description: Alerts are classified by severity to help prioritize response:

critical.label: Critical
critical.description: Immediate action required - critical system failures or security risks

high.label: High
high.description: Urgent attention needed - significant issues affecting operations

medium.label: Medium
medium.description: Should be addressed soon - potential problems identified

low.label: Low
low.description: Monitor - minor issues that can be addressed during maintenance

info.label: Info
info.description: Informational - status changes and non-critical notifications

cooldown.title: Alert Cooldown
cooldown.description: Configure cooldown periods to prevent alert fatigue. Once an alert fires for a host+rule combination, subsequent alerts are suppressed for the cooldown duration (default: 60 minutes).

filters.title: Host Filters
filters.description: Apply alert rules to specific hosts using tag-based filters. For example, create different alerting policies for production vs. development environments.

multi_channel.title: Multi-Channel Routing
multi_channel.description: Link multiple notification channels to a single rule. Critical alerts can go to both email and Slack, while informational alerts might only go to a webhook.

acknowledge.title: Alert Acknowledgment
acknowledge.description: Acknowledge alerts to indicate they're being addressed. Acknowledged alerts are tracked with username and timestamp for audit purposes.

resolution.title: Alert Resolution
resolution.description: Mark alerts as resolved when the underlying issue is fixed. Resolution status helps track mean time to resolution (MTTR) metrics.

steps.navigate: Navigate to Alerts > Alert Rules in the main navigation
steps.create: Click "Create Rule" to open the rule editor
steps.name: Enter a descriptive name for the rule
steps.condition: Select the condition type and configure its parameters
steps.channels: Select one or more notification channels
steps.save: Save the rule - it will be evaluated on the next cycle

configuring_channels.title: Configuring Notification Channels
configuring_channels.description: Configure notification channels in Settings > Alerting:

api.title: API Access
api.description: The Alerting Engine is fully accessible via the REST API:

evaluation.title: Alert Evaluation
evaluation.description: The alerting engine runs in the background and evaluates all enabled rules:
evaluation.async: Asynchronous evaluation prevents blocking the main application
evaluation.cooldown: Cooldown periods prevent duplicate alerts for the same issue
evaluation.notifications: Notifications are dispatched immediately when alerts fire

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.license: Professional or Enterprise license with alerting_engine module
requirements.network: Network connectivity to license server for module download
requirements.webhooks: Outbound network access for webhook/Slack/Teams notifications

compliance.meta_description: Automated compliance assessments against industry frameworks with detailed reporting and remediation guidance.

header.title: Compliance Engine Module
header.description: Automated compliance assessments against industry frameworks with detailed reporting and remediation guidance for regulatory requirements.

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: The Compliance Engine automates the assessment of your infrastructure against industry-standard security frameworks. It evaluates system configurations, identifies compliance gaps, and provides actionable remediation steps to help you meet regulatory requirements.

frameworks.title: Supported Frameworks
frameworks.description: Assess your infrastructure against multiple compliance frameworks:

cis.title: CIS Benchmarks
cis.description: Center for Internet Security benchmarks for operating systems, including Level 1 and Level 2 profiles.

custom.title: Custom Policies
custom.description: Define custom compliance policies tailored to your organization's specific requirements.

checks.title: Compliance Checks
checks.description: The compliance engine evaluates numerous configuration aspects:

status.title: Compliance Status
status.description: Each compliance check returns one of the following statuses:

pass.label: Pass
pass.description: System configuration meets the compliance requirement

fail.label: Fail
fail.description: Configuration does not meet the requirement - remediation needed

warning.label: Warning
warning.description: Partially compliant or manual verification required

skip.label: Skipped
skip.description: Check not applicable to this system or platform

reporting.title: Compliance Reporting
reporting.description: Generate detailed compliance reports in multiple formats:

features.pdf: PDF reports for executive summaries and auditors
features.csv: CSV exports for data analysis and tracking
features.json: JSON format for integration with other tools

steps.navigate: Navigate to the host detail page

viewing.title: Viewing Results
viewing.failed: List of failed checks with remediation steps

bulk.title: Bulk Assessments
bulk.description: Run compliance assessments across multiple hosts at once from the Compliance dashboard. Filter by tags to assess specific groups of hosts.

api.title: API Access
api.description: The Compliance Engine is accessible via the REST API:

remediation.title: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Each failed check includes detailed remediation guidance:

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.network: Network connectivity to license server for module download
requirements.agent: SysManage agent with privileged execution for system inspection
